storyInfo: The Troupe Leader recounts everything that has happened on the plate and expounds on his 'aesthetics of death'. Lucian states his purpose plainly: he's here to kill him—again.

attributes.content: My deepest apologies for ruining the play.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: If you are referring to how you dealt with that Moira girl... then you owe me no apologies, Lucian.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: With your intellect, I can only assume you've figured out the original ending of the story.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: An old case from five years ago, and a Catastrophe that arrives right on cue. Both the storm and the delayed judgment rain down on this plate.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: The Zalak, who once stood outside the story, slowly walks to the center of the stage—and kills all those burdened with sin.
attributes.name: Lucian
Lucian
attributes.content: Later, she comes to realize that everything she's done has been driven by delusion. She awakens—hollowed out, broken—and judges the last remaining soul—

attributes.name: Lucian
attributes.content: Herself.
attributes.joined: Later, she comes to realize that everything she's done has been driven by delusion. She awakens—hollowed out, broken—and judges the last remaining soul—Herself.

attributes.content: And you?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: In the script, you are the Messenger who happens to pass through, the insignificant newcomer to the cast. You are so far removed from the core conflict, yet in the end, you become the one who ties all the threads together.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: The more unexpected the 'coincidence,' the more shocking it is when the 'inevitable' unfolds... This is the allure of drama, something you and I have experienced countless times.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: So, you haven't ruined a thing. You've merely added to the performance.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: ...Just like what you've done for the Troupe.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: I've suffered all manner of tragedy in my quest to find you.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Haha. Naturally.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: The Troupe's mark at the auction was insufficient proof of my existence, I suppose?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Thankfully.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: After all these years, 'death', or rather, 'destruction', remains the plot device you wield so well, the ending you so cherish.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Child, oh child, how I wish you could appreciate its beauty.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Hmm... do I?
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: I wouldn't say I 'appreciate' it, but I am very familiar with it.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: I've acted in so many plays. I've killed so many people. My hands are drenched with blood.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: That is the education and training I received in my childhood, the life you instilled in me.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: You are my best student, Lucian.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Before the climactic finale arrives, let us review the performance so far. You and I know this routine all too well.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: The Troupe Leader smiles and bows towards Lucian. His scepter, wrapped by his tail, points toward the approaching Catastrophe clouds, like a pen dipped in ink.
A familiar scene unfolds before Lucian's eyes. He knows he can't refuse—no, this is what he came for.
Lucian gives a slight nod.
First we have Dalton.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Originally, this middle-aged actor who resembled nothing more than a walking corpse didn't feel this scene was all that significant.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: He offered up what little lucidity he could muster, summoned the last dregs of his acting instincts, recited his few remaining lines, and held out until the director called cut—all to earn just enough for another night of drinking.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: He has never mourned the actress who died because of him, nor reminisced about his once spirited past. He was not even ashamed of his current sorry state.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: You manipulated him.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Indeed. Without my intervention, he would never have taken it upon himself to retrieve the swapped knife and deliver it to you.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: But I never commanded him to put his chest up to the blade.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: By the time you were acting opposite him, he was already fully awake, fully aware of the danger he was in.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Lucian, your talent shines just as brightly in film as it did on the stage.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Your performance awakened his memories, reminding him of how great an actor he once was, of a time when he was immersed in his roles, expressing real emotions: joy, sorrow, fury, and mirth.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: In that moment, 'the Messenger' slipped fully into character, while the looming threat of financial ruin warped 'Sir Dupont's' thoughts.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: He had to cover up the truth. He had to do whatever it took to kill the person before him—without pausing to think that his own blade might be turned on him.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: You were right there with him—you know better than anyone just how intense his fear and anger were in that moment.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: As a farewell performance, it was nearly perfect.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Indeed, death's imminent approach did not frighten him. Instead, it ignited his competitive fire, which had long been dulled by drink. He performed with unrestrained zeal. It was exhilarating!
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Then there was Michael and Marion.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: The philandering actor and the shrewd costume designer were found hanging above their own set, their farcical romance laid bare for all to see.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Their union was both shameful and absurd—a mess of indulgent desire, scheming ambition, mutual disdain, and mutual exploitation.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: There wasn't a trace of anything real about them, inside or out. That Michael—even his ears and tail were fake.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Their deaths served no purpose, save for giving that camera assistant a juicy bit of gossip to peddle.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: But you, Lucian, you were at the scene. Even the cat could taste the lingering emotions left behind.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: When Moira knocked on that door, when the footsteps of death drew near, in that fleeting moment where there was no time to think, I'm sure you know what each of them did.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Tear stains.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: What a fascinating detail.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Tear stains lingered in the corners of his eyes—none of the three Rockefeller brothers had ever shown Lady Dupont such heartfelt emotion.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: That fireman's axe was originally meant for Marion.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Yet Michael shielded her from harm, exposing himself to the blade instead.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: In the last moments of their lives, that man and that woman, who up to that point had been attacking each other, instinctively protected each other.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: They confirmed their true feelings for one another.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Although this, by itself, is not worthy of praise.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: You're correct, my child.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: However, the audience had already taken their seats. What did they expect to see in this illusion of light and sound?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Ultimately, the schemers will end up with nothing while the hedonists are devoured by their own desires, yes? Naturally. It's the neatest kind of story—just an excuse to trot out well-worn platitudes.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: They would never imagine that a flawed, 'unworthy' love could still be real, and still turn heads.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Just as those two never imagined there would be a moment when they grew feelings for each other.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Made possible by death?
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Made possible by death.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: And then, of course, there was Moira—the one I had the highest hopes for, before you showed up.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Moira rebuilt her faith through another's death.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Every detail about Laura was etched into her mind: her name, her eating habits, her unmistakable smile, her extraordinary life, her violent end, and the killers who still hadn't been brought to justice.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Grief, anger, doubt, hatred—every emotion that rose within her set fire to a buried past, and to herself.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: She directed this entire performance.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Why do you insist on downplaying your own role in all of this?
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: It was you who inserted that ad-libbing, forcing a past that did not originally exist into her mind—bringing 'Laura' into her life.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Yes. And what of it?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Look at her—
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: She is dancing.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: You were her dance partner back then. You must have felt it.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: She isn't like the children from the Crimson Troupe, who've been receiving Whiteflower's training since they were young. But when you look at her dancing, her physique, her tears, her smile...
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: She is acting out a version of life. Or perhaps crafting a kind of truth. Or perhaps she no longer has any constraints, and can be whoever she wants to be.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: She will dance through countless people's lives, dithyramb unending, until her mind and body can no longer bear the weight of those emotions.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Or maybe she will finally encounter you, or some other fool seeking the truth, and one night finally awaken from her dream and end her own life.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Regardless of her ultimate fate, her soul will be rich and fulfilled.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Regardless of her ultimate fate, she is already no longer just a nameless prop-maker from the frontier. No longer a Zalak with nothing and no one to hold on to.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: You're as talkative as ever, Troupe Leader.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: It's been a long time since you've spoken about someone with such passion.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: ...Not since you, Lucian.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: I don't deny that I've exerted my influence on Moira. I encouraged her, just as I once encouraged you.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: My child, have you forgotten?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: If not for your thirst to perform, you would have died long ago.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: When that Catastrophe drove you from your home, when you lost your parents, when you found yourself adrift in that towering castle amongst strangers, you said—
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Only when I'm in character, on the stage...
attributes.name: Young Lucian

attributes.content: That's the only time my loneliness disappears...
attributes.name: Young Lucian

attributes.content: The only time I feel like I belong.
attributes.name: Young Lucian

attributes.content: You clung to that feeling, and it kept you alive.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: You and Moira... You're both natural-born actors. You both create sorrow and joy from nothing, and use those emotions to survive.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: No one can ignore your brilliance!
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: And for both of you, my two children, death shall be your teacher.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Do you still remember when you hit that wall in your development? When you could not draw inspiration from anything, and were unable to power your performance?
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: That was when you thrust that Originium into your throat without hesitation.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Then you felt the grip of death, of your inescapable fate!
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: It gave you fear, jealousy, sorrow, anger, shame, and greed—emotions once foreign to you... And after witnessing all of these things, your heart has become a mirror.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: It fueled your desire to dismantle authority, your thirst for destruction. It gave you an endless night—and a song that never ceases.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: It turned the unassuming Lucian into a gleaming Blood Diamond.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: 'Blood Diamond'...
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: My eternal moniker.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Think of Dalton, child, think of Michael and Marion, think of Laura and Moira. Look at all these souls still struggling through the Catastrophe... and look at yourself.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: You're right—death is still the device I wield best, and the ending I've always favored.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: But I do not see death as 'destruction'.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: It drives the mighty to disgrace themselves, the devoted to break their commandments, the pure to sink into filth, and the heroic to commit treachery!
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: It gives strength to the dejected, compels the silent to shout their ideals, draws real emotion from the self-absorbed, and frees the timid from their inhibitions!
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: It shows climbers the next foothold, and gives the farsighted the courage to leap. It turns self-proclaimed beacons into the real thing!
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: It sows meaning and waters flaws. It cultivates truth and fertilizes falsehoods. It turns dying flesh into blooming flowers, and engraves what would fade without a trace!
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: It is agony without relief, and overflowing inspiration!
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: It is drama's cause and consequence, its flesh and its soul—the great force behind creation, the law and tether that binds every ideology, every style, every exploration.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: It is the appointed end, where all things return to dust!
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: The Troupe Leader turns to Lucian, that same smile still lingering on his lips. The wind and sand howl around them, but he remains unfazed.
Child, death is also our chance to reunite.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: What a shame. Quite a monologue, yet such little applause.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Because I am the only one standing across from you—and the only one who ever could.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Noise sounds out from all directions, and Lucian listens intently.
The Catastrophe rages. Miss.Christine lets out a low howl—something she would normally never do. Their newly acquainted companions scatter in panic, crying out for help in vain...
As the Troupe Leader said, death is unfolding on stage—what began with a few intense scenes has now taken over the entire production.
You say death is our chance to reunite. I completely agree.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: So I won't waste this opportunity.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: If I may, I'd like to share a few thoughts of my own, now that you've finished your analysis. After all, both you and I know this routine by heart.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: The storm snaps off part of the scaffold, sending a shower of sparks. A nearby rug catches fire, and the flames leap dangerously close to Lucian's side.
But he does not even flinch. He stares intently at the person standing before him and removes his hat.
All this time, ever since you reappeared, you haven't even mentioned the many times I've betrayed you. Why?
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: (Smiles)
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Because that is unimportant. Because you are still you, child.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Getting lost in madness, then returning to clarity. Leaving, only to later return... After all the trials and tribulations, a hard-won reunion is all the more precious. In the end, time can forgive all grievances.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Is that so?
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: I used to think the Crimson Troupe was your quill, your canvas, and your trap. I thought that in this chaotic world, your audiences sought solace in your performances. I thought you were omnipresent and that no one could escape your grasp.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Which is why the plan that I, Shalem, and the Playwright came up with failed.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Back then, I was young—naive and full of pride. We believed we had seen the Troupe for what it really was. But our carefully planned escape turned out to be just another act in your grand play.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: In the end, Shalem fled from you in fear, while I came to you.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: You returned to my side.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: That was the moment when you decided to learn all of my techniques. You resolved to learn everything you could about the Troupe, then use that information to destroy it.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Your plan was to use death to stop death and to use destruction to stop destruction.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Whiteflower, Bladedance, Shadow... the teachers you once learned from all died by your hands.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: ...As did I.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: I remember my voice, wild and cracking with rage... and the sudden warmth that surged from your chest the moment the blade went in. I thought I had destroyed the Crimson Troupe for good.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: And despite all that, I still failed.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: You didn't die.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Because death is ever-present, and drama is eternal.
attributes.name: Troupe Leader

attributes.content: Eternal, yes, but after that, I devoted even more time to studying all your greatest works... including myself.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: I wore down your eternity, as any slow-witted disciple might.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: And at last, I've arrived, once more stepping into your proud creation: a theater of death, of tragedy, of art.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Now, at last, the Catastrophe has finished setting our final stage.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Troupe Leader, my dear teacher, or perhaps I should call you 'Tragodia'.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: I am going to destroy everything that is yours.
attributes.name: Lucian

attributes.content: Lucian unfastens the inhibitor at his throat. The exposed Originium crystals gleam, as if already rejoicing at the song to come.
He offers the Troupe Leader a deep bow, as the clouds behind him come crashing down.
